definition: Lin Chong, one of the Heroes of the Marsh in Water Margin
surname Lin/Japanese surname Hayashi
woods/forest/CL:片[pian4]/circle(s) (i.e. specific group of people)/a collection (of similar things)
powerful/vigorous/pungent/towards/in view of
thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with

sentences.english: Lin Ch'ung stayed with Ch'ai Chin in the village for several days and was entertained by Ch'ai Chin every day.
sentences.chinese: 柴进留林冲在庄上一连住了几日，每日好酒好食相待。

sentences.english: The snowstorm was so terrible that I had to share an umbrella with Lin.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雪很可怕，我只能和林冲合用一把伞了。

sentences.english: Lin Chong is one of successfully described figures in Outlaws of the Marsh .
sentences.chinese: 林冲是《水浒传》中塑造较为成功的人物之一。

sentences.english: Lin Ch'ung put his pack and quilt on the bed and sat there by the fire.
sentences.chinese: 林冲就床上放了包裹被卧，坐下生些焰火起来。

sentences.english: Lin Chong and Lu Zhishen were sworn brothers.
sentences.chinese: 林冲和鲁智深是结拜兄弟。

sentences.english: As well, the paper described the treatment proposal for tailings dam closing in detail.
sentences.chinese: 详细叙述了林冲尾矿库闭库治理流程。

sentences.english: Lin Ch'ung felt faint and still could hardly walk.
sentences.chinese: 林冲起来，晕了，吃不得，又走不动。

sentences.english: He acted Lin Chong in the Beijing opera Driven to Join the Liangshan Rebels.
sentences.chinese: 他在京剧《逼上梁山》里去林冲。

sentences.english: Lin Chong left home for Liang Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 林冲离开家到梁山去了。

definition: Wu Song, a heroic outlaw of Liangshan po 梁山泊 in the classic novel Water Margin 水滸傳|水浒传, whose exploits including killing a tiger with his bare hands
Song Jiang, a principal hero of the novel Water Margin 水滸傳|水浒传
Li Kui, character in the novel Water Margin 水滸全傳|水浒全传[Shui3 hu3 quan2 zhuan4]
Liangshan city and County in Jining 濟寧|济宁[Ji3 ning2], Shandong
Huang Xin, character in The Water Margin
Wu Yong, character of 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4], nicknamed Resourceful Star 智多星[Zhi4 duo1 xing1]
Fang La
Water Margin or Outlaws of the Marsh by Shi Nai'an 施耐庵[Shi1 Nai4 an1], one of the Four Classic Novels of Chinese literature
Wang Ying (character in the "Water Margin")
edge of the water/shore or sea, lake or river/seashore
Shi Nai'an (1296-1371), author of Water Margin or Outlaws of the Marsh 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4]
Ximen Qing, character from 金瓶梅[Jin1 ping2 mei2] and 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4]
Yue Fei (1103-1142), Song dynasty patriot and general
Pan Jinlian (name lit. Golden Lotus), heroine of Ming dynasty vernacular novel Jinpingmei or the Golden Lotus 金瓶梅
Lü Bu (-198), general and warlord
Zhang Fei (168-221), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, famous as fearsome fighter and lover of wine
